TopicTitle: KSP freezing my whole computer on modded 1.5.1

Articles.Content: After I had finished building a base in Kerbal Konstructs, I closed the game to make a custom head pack for Texture Replacer. After making the heads, I loaded the game and it appeared to load normally, but once I got to the black screen with the "Loading" spinner, my computer started lagging until my mouse, drawing tablet, and CTRL+ALT+DEL stopped working. All I can do is hard reboot my computer. Unmodded 1.5.1 works just fine. Any way to fix?       Specs:  3500MHZ AMD Ryzen 5 Quad-Core, nVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060, Windows 10 x64, 16GB RAM    Mods: HyperEdit, MechJeb2, TweakScale, VesselMover, EnviromentalVisualEnchancements, Alternis Kerbol, scatterer, Kopernicus, OPM, OPMVO, ProcedualParts, ReentryParticleEffect, KerbalKonstructs, OSSNTR, ExtraplanetaryLaunchpads, KAS, Chatterer, BetterTimeWarp, TextureReplacer        Please help

Hi.

Without the full KSP.log and, since you machine is crashing, the Player.log too, we can't do too much.

Please publish KSP.log and Player.log on a file sharing service as DropBox or Google Drive. Using snippets sharing services as gist or pastbin will not do, as they have limits on the file size to be shared and these log files are way bigger than that.

Give a peek on TweakScale's OP under the Spoiler Support in order to learn where to get those files.

 

Edited June 12, 2020 by Lisias
Kraken damned autocompletes.
After reading my log, I found out that it was an Kerbal Konstructs static that was placed in an invalid position that caused an overflow in the windows kernel. Thanks for reminding me about the log.
